image.altText: Jessie smiles into the camera, at a polling booth with posters around her, wearing an orange jumper and leather jacket.

props.synopsis: The vote count for the southern ACT electorate of Bean looks set to drag on for days, as the margin between the Labor incumbent and the independent challenger remains exceptionally close.

title.children: Bean counting continues with few votes between Jessie Price and Labor

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: An elusive fraudster who has three times failed to come to Canberra from South Australia to be sentenced for theft and burglary is facing extradition, after a warrant was issued for his arrest.

title.children: Man who stole thousands from Flight Centre facing extradition to ACT

image.altText: The ACT law courts building at night.

props.synopsis: Dhiren Patel faces three charges of rape, among other offences relating to the alleged sexual assault of a 15-year-old girl. Magistrate Alexandra Burt told the court it was a strong prosecution case, partly because some of the incident was captured on CCTV.

title.children: 'Let's keep this a secret': Canberra cafe manager accused of raping 15yo

image.altText: A dog on leash walking down a hospital corridor.

props.synopsis: Dogs aren't what you'd expect to see when you step into an intensive care unit, but a study at the Canberra Hospital has found bringing therapy dogs onto the ward reduces anxiety and pain for critically ill patients.

title.children: Therapy dogs reducing pain and anxiety for intensive care patients

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with a small Bluey toy and colourful dollhouse.

props.synopsis: More than 1,100 children may be left without daycare as the fate of centres run by the Genius childcare empire remains in limbo.

title.children: Millions in debt mounting as Genius childcare provider searches for lifeline

image.altText: Three mothers with sombre looks outside the ACT Legislative Assembly.

props.synopsis: Bereaved Indigenous mothers turn their grief into strength as they welcome the ACT government's backing of a board of inquiry into the treatment of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander detainees.

title.children: Bereaved mothers welcome inquiry into treatment of Indigenous detainees

image.altText: The earless dragon in an enclosure, standing on a rock.

props.synopsis: The Canberra grassland earless dragon is critically endangered and there are fears it could disappear forever. Environmentalists have expressed concerns over the construction of a new road that is impacting the species' habitat.

title.children: Plan to bring Australia's 'most endangered reptile species' back from the brink

image.altText: new pope leo dressed in white robes raises his hands to deliver mass to cardinals

props.synopsis: Addressing the cardinals in English, he said "you have called me to carry the cross and to be blessed" and asked for their help to spread the Catholic faith.

title.children: New Pope Leo XIV vows to bring light to the world's 'dark nights'

image.altText: Cricketer Mitchell Starc with teammates wait for an umpire decision.

props.synopsis: The IPL will reportedly be postponed due to the ongoing conflict between India and Pakistan.

title.children: IPL tournament suspended amid India-Pakistan conflict as Australians look to fly home

image.altText: A Philippine Navy AW159 helicopter with the the HMAS Sydney in the background.

props.synopsis: China's Foreign Ministry sharply criticises Australia after joint drills in the South China Sea with the US and the Philippines, accusing all three nations of trying to "create trouble."

title.children: China criticises Australia over joint exercises in South China Sea

image.altText: Mitch McGovern lays on the turf after being bumped

props.synopsis: Carlton defender Mitch McGovern is sent to hospital to get scans on his chest after being floored by a brutal bump in the first quarter a courageous win over St Kilda.

title.children: Carlton records courageous win as McGovern is rushed to hospital after brutal hit

image.altText: Payne Haas of the Broncos (centre) and teammates react following their loss

props.synopsis: After a 22-14 loss to South Sydney marked the fourth loss in five games for Brisbane, NRL great Johnathan Thurston questions if the Broncos have improved since finishing 12th in 2024.

title.children: Thurston questions if Broncos are any better than dismal 2024 season

image.altText: A gecko peeks out of the palm of someone's hands.

props.synopsis: New Caledonia's giant geckos are the latest sensation in the global pet trade. But conservationists warn their social media-fuelled popularity is putting the endangered species at risk.

title.children: The online gecko craze turning into a conservation nightmare

image.altText: Police officers in uniform patrolling a street.

props.synopsis: A former employee of Tasmania's notorious Ashley Youth Detention Centre has been arrested over alleged serious sexual offences, including child sexual abuse, while he was working at the centre.

title.children: Fomer employee of notorious Tasmanian children's prison charged over alleged abuse

image.altText: A group of 8 people are standing in front of a table where two agreements are held up. they are standing outside

props.synopsis: A regional town in New South Wales is making history with a "momentous" partnership that embeds Closing the Gap targets into local government processes for the first time.

title.children: 'Historic' deal embeds Indigenous decision-making in local council

image.altText: Aerial shot of Alice Springs township, 2019.

props.synopsis: Police have charged the 28-year-old with a series of child abuse offences, including one count of sexual intercourse with a child under 10, following a search at an Alice Springs home.

title.children: Man charged in Alice Springs over alleged rape of child following FBI tip-off

image.altText: two Ukrainian soldiers operate an air defense system on the back of a truck

props.synopsis: Ukraine said it was the first time in its history that a Hungarian spy network had been found to be working against Kyiv's interests.

title.children: Ukraine says it caught Hungarian spies surveilling air defence systems

image.altText: Painting of black and white figure suspended in air.

props.synopsis: Women's labour is in the spotlight in Brisbane artist Julie Fragar's portrait Flagship Mother Multiverse (Justene), which has won the $100,000 Archibald Prize.

title.children: Julie Fragar wins $100,000 Archibald Prize for portrait of fellow artist

image.altText: Stuart MacGill wearing a suit outside court

props.synopsis: Former Australian cricketer Stuart MacGill avoids jail after being found guilty of taking part in the supply of cocaine in Sydney.

title.children: Retired cricketer sentenced over 'indispensable role' in $330k drug deal

image.altText: Raghe Mohammed Abdi smiles a the camera. He wears a school uniform consisting of a maroon jacket and tie, and a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: Raghe Mohamed Abdi murdered two people before he was shot and killed by police on the Logan Motorway.

title.children: Coroner unable to determine 'radicalised' man's motive for killing elderly couple

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: The TV show has adults talking or, shall we say, anxious. But what do young people think about it?

title.children: 'It's like real life': Teens divided over showing Adolescence in schools

image.altText: Bill Gates with a tight-lipped smile

props.synopsis: Bill Gates aims to donate $US200 billion to his foundation in 20 years time, and calls out Elon Musk for "killing the world's poorest children".

title.children: Gates pledges to donate 99pc of fortune, accuses Musk of harming world's poorest

image.altText: Cassius montage

props.synopsis: A memorial plaque for Cassius Turvey in his community of Midland, east of Perth, sits as an enduring reminder of the legacy he left behind: "gentle giant", "huggable teddy bear", and a "young leader".

title.children: Big in stature, with even bigger heart, Cassius's death shocked nation

image.altText: A man in a brightly-coloured swimming cap and rash vest bodysurfs a wave.

props.synopsis: The world's best bodysurfers flocked to the Sunshine Coast to push the limits of the sport. Among them was Australian Olympic legend Susie O'Neill.

title.children: Bodysurfing world titles take simple pastime to next level

image.altText: An older man stands in front of rows of wine in a store.

props.synopsis: A mourner of grocer Linford Feick, who was fatally stabbed last month, was taken to hospital with an eye injury after being struck by a brick thrown from a moving car.

title.children: Slain NT grocer funeral guest hit by brick allegedly thrown at car

image.altText: Former Queensland Government minister Gordon Nuttall

props.synopsis: From politician to prisoner, Gordon Nuttall has died aged 71 years old after being diagnosed with stage four kidney cancer.

title.children: Disgraced former Queensland minister Gordon Nuttall dies

image.altText: Sheikh Wesam Charkawi, The Muslim Vote convener

props.synopsis: Labor maintained their key seats in Western Sydney, but it was not without a fight.

title.children: 'No question' Gaza played role in Western Sydney seats swing

image.altText: Blonde-haired woman in blue jumper, in kitchen near pink orchid flower

props.synopsis: The NSW building regulator has agreed to use an independent third-party manager to oversee the repair of hundreds of defective homes at Shell Cove, south of Wollongong.

title.children: Building watchdog to oversee repair of hundreds of defective homes

image.altText: Michael Storer competes at Paris Nice in the snow

props.synopsis: There are 14 Australian riders riding this year's Giro d'Italia, but Michael Storer is coming in with red-hot form and a dream of usurping the long list of favourites, who will have their own Aussie riders in support.

title.children: How this understated Aussie's 'unreal' level could upset the Giro favourites

image.altText: Romney Hamilton and her husband and dog

props.synopsis: The celebration of Mother's Day can be triggering for people who have experienced infertility or are trying for a baby.

title.children: Getting through Mother's Day if you're struggling with infertility

image.altText: An unidentified man using a chainsaw to trim a tree branch

props.synopsis: Having trees and shrubs encroaching on your property is a common problem, but it is important to take the right steps to address it.

title.children: Can you cut your neighbour's overhanging trees? Here are the rules

image.altText: A dead penguin lays on a beach.

props.synopsis: The Department for Environment and Water said it was unclear at this stage if new penguin deaths on the Eyre Peninsula were linked to the ongoing algal bloom across South Australia.

title.children: Dead little penguins wash up on multiple Eyre Peninsula beaches

image.altText: Suited choir gesture with arms while standing on steps

props.synopsis: With an election, a papal conclave, and a whole lot of wild outfits on the Met Gala red carpet, it's been a big week in news. See how much you remember from the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Dutton's seat, the Met Gala and Trump

image.altText: Wynyard Wildcatz 3

props.synopsis: Many of the team of cheerleading girls from a tiny town in Tasmania had never even been on a plane, let alone left their country, but a fundraising effort to see them sent to the US has paid off.

title.children: Tears, joy at Tassie girls' shock win at US cheerleading competition
